articles.title: Anaïs Rouanet
articles.contents:
Anaïs Rouanet

              Anaïs Rouanet

            I am a postdoctoral researcher working at the Bordeaux
            Population Health research center (Inserm U1219),
            Biostatistics team. My main areas of research focus on the
            development of biostatistical methods for the study of brain
            aging, in particular semi-supervised clustering and joint
            modelling approaches for multivariate longitudinal data and
            time-to-event data.
            In 2017-2019, I worked at the Institute of Public Health,
            Medical Research Council, Cambridge University, in the
            Biostatistics Unit, on the development of nonparametric
            Bayesian methods for clustering from longitudinal data and
            correlated covariates.
            In 2016, I was awarded my Ph.D. in Public Health,
            Biostatistics, from the Bordeaux University (“Study of
            dementia and cognitive decline accounting for selection by
            death”).
